name: CoRoT-6
scenarioDescription:
The CoRoT-6 Exoplanetary System


Overview

CoRoT-6 is a star with 1.05 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.02 times its radius. It is located 2143.63 light years away from the solar system.

CoRoT-6 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the CoRoT-6 system


CoRoT-6 b

CoRoT-6 b was discovered by the CoRoT observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of CoRoT-6 b is 941.28 times the mass of Earth. The radius of CoRoT-6 b is 13.068 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, CoRoT-6 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system CoRoT-6, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by CoRoT.
